name: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
Reference Documents: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
1.3 - Submission & Approval of Concrete Mix Design
Frequency: Prior to first concrete pour

Acceptance Criteria: The Contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete. Concrete shall not be placed until the mix design has been reviewed by the Superintendent
Record of conformity: ITP Signed, Mix design approval

Acceptance Criteria: Set out work in accordance with drawings. The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Frequency: For Each Day of Activity
Acceptance Criteria: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing. Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
Acceptance Criteria: Excavation completed to required depth to allow placement of the concrete blinding layer.
Acceptance Criteria: 12mm Diamond dowel at X centres
Frequency: Before placement of ACO DRAIN sections
Acceptance Criteria: 150mm concrete blinding to base of proposed ACO DRAIN.
Reference Documents: Trench grate joint detail with concrete pavement
Acceptance Criteria: Formwork shall comply with the requirements of AS 3610 where required
Acceptance Criteria: 12mm Abelflex seal with approved sealant against existing and adjacent concrete pavements
Reference Documents: Trench grate joint detail with concrete pavement
Acceptance Criteria: ACO drain sections to be placed in trench with lid surface flush with adjacent pacement surfaces. Ensure a 150mm width either side of ACO DRAIN to existing pavements.
Reference Documents: Trench grate joint detail with concrete pavement
Frequency: Each section of ACO trench

Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall be thoroughly compacted via contious tamping and internal vibration. Where concrete is unformed it shall be hand tamped to a smooth surface and screeded in accordance with the construction drawings.
○ Where fresh concrete is being placed against concrete which has taken initial set a properly formed construction joint must be used.
○ N25 concrete as per installation drawing - ACO Drain
Reference Documents: SPECIFICATION CLAUSE KLASSIKDRAIN K200 - LOAD CLASS A-B
Acceptance Criteria: Batch location recorded on Load Batch Traceability Checklist
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Concrete elements shall have a Class 3 surface finish for external surfaces and a Class 4 surface finish for permanently hidden surfaces in accordance with AS 3610.
○ Footpaths and other Surfacing shall be compelted with a wooden float.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: tool joints to be formed at each ACO joint.
Reference Documents: SPECIFICATION CLAUSE KLASSIKDRAIN K200 - LOAD CLASS A-B
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.
○ Vehicles equal to or less than 1.5 tonnes in weight may be permitted to cross after 4 days, vehicles greater than 1.5 tonnes may be permitted to cross after 7 days.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall be cured immediately either by water curing, wet hessian, polyethylene sheeting which is adequately sealed, curing compound or a combination of these.
○ Curing compounds shall comply with AS 3799. The curing compound shall be applied in two coats using a fine spray at the rate stated on the certificate of compliance
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
3.1 - Carry out sampling of concrete - strength and consistency
Acceptance Criteria: Sampling and testing of the strength of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 6.2 of AS 1379.
○ The consistency of the concrete shall be determined by a slump test of each concrete strength sample in accordance with AS 1012.3 and Clause 5.2 of AS 1379
Record of conformity: ITP Signed/Test Records
Acceptance Criteria: Where matching in with existing surface levels, the new surface shall be within ± 5mm existing.
Section dimensions shall be constructed within the following tolerances:
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
Reference Documents: IFC Project Drawings/ Drawing Register
Record of conformity: Latest revision IFC drawings
1.2 - Confirm understanding of current EMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place

Acceptance Criteria: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current CEMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Acceptance Criteria: Approved TMP and WASIN (where required)
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection

Acceptance Criteria: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and set out activity. IFC and latest available revision used.
Record of conformity: Survey records & marks on the ground. This ITP Signed off.
Frequency: Every batch of new material
Acceptance Criteria: Fire Service pipe material to be free from defects and meet the following schedules
○ As per B.6.1 Fire Pipe Schedule and B.6.2 Valves and Fittings Schedule.
Record of conformity: ITP signed, Receival Inspection Checklist
Frequency: Every batch of new material
Acceptance Criteria: Inspect bedding and backfill material to ensure suitability. If watermain is to be protected, use stabilised sand or concrete encasement
Record of conformity: ITP signed, Receival Inspection Checklist
Acceptance Criteria: Trench's to be excavated to conform with IFC drawing details.
○ Ensure trench width and depth are within tolerance
○ Ensure trench foundation & wall firm, stiff & suitable
○ Provide minimum clear space of 100mm between pipe and trench face

Acceptance Criteria: Trench support is required where the trench is more than 1.5 metres, unless the trench has been assessed as safe by a geotechnical engineer and written confirmation provided as such.
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding materials : 7mm single sized aggregate used
○ Bedding Depth: 75-100mm COMPACTED DEPTH, BEDDING MATERIAL INCREASED TO 150mm WHER EEXCAVATING IN ROCK

Acceptance Criteria: Ensure pipe joint deflection is acceptable, as per drawings and product specifications. Ensure all Butt Fusion Welds are completed are correctly (butt fusion weld indicator showing).
○ Prior to completing any works on existing infrastructure, ensure line is isolated.
Record of conformity: ITP signed, photo of each joint

Acceptance Criteria: Horizontal alignment of a completed length of pipework is laid beneath areas of normal usage but where passing under areas of vehicular traffic must be subject to a minimum cover of 750mm or as otherwise directed
○ A minimum cover of 450mm and 750 mm for pipework must be provided under unpaved and paved area respectively
Frequency: Each Lot prior to Backfill
Acceptance Criteria: Survey pick for As-built to be completed prior to Backfill

Acceptance Criteria: A compacted sand bed of 75mm minimum thickness over earth or 150mm minimum thickness over rock must be provided. The pipework must be topped with 100mm minimum thickness of sand compacted carefully by watering and hard or light vibratory tamping to a dense tight state.
Frequency: Subbase one test per 1000 sq.m
Acceptance Criteria: Backfill compacted in <= 250mm loose layers to achieve minimum density R_D 95% (MDDR = 95%).
Acceptance Criteria: Tape widths must be as recommended by the manufacturer for the size of pipe to be covered but must be not less than 75mm wide for pipework up to 50mm dia.
Acceptance Criteria: Install valves in the vertical position and provide surface fittings and valve markings in accordance with Drawings
○ Inspect the valve for damage. Repair any damage to the external coating in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions
○ Check the valve and off-take clamp flanges to ensure the sleeves fit in the bolt holes. Trim insulation sleeves such that they join inside one flange, and not at the flange joint.
○ Ø150 U.P.V.C. (AS1477 CLASS 4.5) PIPE SLEEVE to be installed
Reference Documents: Drawing(s): EW-FP-DRW-00-0001, SLUICE VALVE DETAIL
Acceptance Criteria: Ø100 HOT DIPPED GALVANIZED PIPE RISER (SINGLE PIPE RISER FROM P.E. PIPE.) to be installed.
○ 600mm x 600mm x 250mm CONCRETE PAD TO STABILIZE HYDRANT RISER. FINISH NOMINAL 25m ABOVE GROUND. Ø200 CAST IRON INSPECTION SHAFT COVER (Valves)
Acceptance Criteria: Thrust blocks must be installed in systems with unrestrained anchors.
Frequency: Completion of pipe installation & fittings.
Acceptance Criteria: Undertake field density testing of trench fill in accordance with the methods specified within Specifcation and Drawings.
○ Testing not required where stablised sand is substitued for rock.
Record of conformity: ITP signed, Test Records
Frequency: Completion of pipe installation & fittings.
Acceptance Criteria: Undertake pressure testing of pipelines in accordance with the methods specified in Specification: EW-FP-SPC-0000001(C.).
○ Refer to Table B.6.1 - Fire Pipe Schedule and AS2419 - Section 7 for test requirements.
Reference Documents: Specification: EW-FP-SPC-0000001(C.), AS2419 - Section 7
Record of conformity: ITP signed, Test Records
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure all conduit deviations are captured on redline drawings for updating the IFC Drawings, and providing asbuilt data.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
Reference Documents: IFC Project Drawings/ Drawing Register
Record of conformity: Latest revision IFC drawings
1.2 - Confirm understanding of current EMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place

Acceptance Criteria: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current CEMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Acceptance Criteria: Approved TMP and WASIN (where required)
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection

Acceptance Criteria: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and set out activity. IFC and latest available revision used.
Record of conformity: Survey records & marks on the ground. This ITP Signed off.
Frequency: Every batch of new material
Acceptance Criteria: Sewer pipe material to be free from defects and be sized to the following:
Record of conformity: ITP signed, Receival Inspection Checklist
Frequency: Every batch of new material
Acceptance Criteria: Inspect bedding and backfill material to ensure suitability. If watermain is to be protected, use stabilised sand or concrete encasement
○ TYPE R - REFER TO TRENCH DETAIL.
Record of conformity: ITP signed, Receival Inspection Checklist
Acceptance Criteria: Trench's to be excavated to conform with IFC drawing details.
○ Sides of excavation to be kept vertical to at least 150mm above the pipe.
○ Ensure trench width and depth are within tolerance
○ Ensure trench foundation & wall firm, stiff & suitable

Acceptance Criteria: Trench support is required where the trench is more than 1.5 metres, unless the trench has been assessed as safe by a geotechnical engineer and written confirmation provided as such.
3.3 - Capping and grouting of abandoned mains
Frequency: Before bedding material is installed
Acceptance Criteria: Where it is necessary to fill a redundant pipeline, low strength grout (<5 MPa), similar material or sand shall be used.
Record of conformity: Release of Hold Point
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding materials : 5 or 7mm single sized aggregate used
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure pipe joint deflection is acceptable, as per drawings and product specifications.
○ ALL JOINTS SHALL BE BUTT WELDED. WHERE BUTT WELDING IS NOT POSSIBLE MECHANICAL
○ JOINTS SHALL BE USED. ELECTROFUSION SHALL NOT BE USED UNLESS APPROVED PRIOR BY THE SUPERINTENDENT.
Record of conformity: ITP signed, photo of each joint
Acceptance Criteria: Embedment Type R including 5/7mm single sized aggregate.
○ Min Overlay: 300mm (Compaction with ride on equipment)
○ Embedment placed under haunches by shovel and worked around pipe to ensure all voids at haunches are filled
Reference Documents: Table 201-D, MRWA-W-201, MRWA-W-202, EW-CE-DRW-600-006
Acceptance Criteria: Backfill compacted in <= 200mm loose layers to achieve minimum density R_D 95% (MDDR = 95%). Avoid compaction within 500mm of top of pipe
○ Non-Trafficable Areas: Below 600mm = 90% MDDR, Above 600mm = 95% MDDR
Reference Documents: MRWA-W-201, MRWA Specification No. 04-03.
Acceptance Criteria: Marking tape to be laid along the route of the alignment ontop of first backfill layer
Acceptance Criteria: Install valves in the vertical position and provide surface fittings and valve markings in accordance with Drawings
○ Inspect the valve for damage. Repair any damage to the external coating in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions
○ Check the valve and off-take clamp flanges to ensure the sleeves fit in the bolt holes. Trim insulation sleeves such that they join inside one flange, and not at the flange joint.
○ Lid on valve to be cenrally placed
Reference Documents: WSA 03-2011 3.1, MRWA-W-300, MRWA-W-301 and MRWA-W-302, EW-CE-DRW-600-004
Acceptance Criteria: DN100 SCOUR/PUMP OUT POINT IN A 1200 CONCRETE MH PIT to be installed where denoted on the drawings.
○ SEWER SCOUR OUTLETS TO BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH STANDARD DRAWINGS SPS-1602 AND SPS-1603
Acceptance Criteria: CONNECTION TO THE EXISTING RISING MAIN MUST BE ANCHORED TO PREVENT MOVEMENT CAUSED BY THRUST IN ACCORDANCE WITH MRWA-W-205A. THRUST BLOCK AREA = 0.89m2
Frequency: Completion of pipe installation & fittings.
Acceptance Criteria: Undertake field density testing of trench fill in accordance with the methods specified in WSA 02 - 2014-3.1
Reference Documents: MRWA Backfill Spec 04-03.2, EW-CE-DRW-600-006
Frequency: Completion of pipe installation & fittings.
Acceptance Criteria: Undertake pressure testing of pipelines in accordance with the methods specified in WSA 02 - 2014-3.1 & WSA 03 - 2011-3.1.
○ Gravity sewer to be tested for 28 Kpa for minimum 3 minutes and sewer rising main to be tested at 31m 1000 Kpa for minimum 2 hours.
Record of conformity: Completed CL-003- Pressure Testing Record & CL-003(A, B or C) -Pressure Testing
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure all conduit deviations are captured on redline drawings for updating the IFC Drawings, and providing asbuilt data for AutoCAD
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
